title: To his Excellencie, the Earl of Forth, Lord Generall of His Majesties army: the humble petition of divers poor prisoners in Oxford-castle, whose names are hereunder written who humble shew, that your poor petitioners have there remained in hard imprisonment, for the space of seven weeks and upwards, ... Wherefore they most humbly beseech your Excellencie to take their distressed condition into your pious consideration; ... Edw. Bradney. ... Jo: Mountgomery. Ordered by the Commons in Parliament, that this petition be forthwith printed and published. Hen: Elsynge, Cler. Parl. D. Com.
publisher: printed for Edw. Husbands, and are to be sold at his shop in the Middle-Temple,
notes: Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
